review: Oh Applebee's what is going on at this location?  I'm not a fan of chains, and really not a big fan of Applebee's.  Aside from their Weight Watchers menu (which is just a genius move on their part) I've never really climbed on board.  However, pregnancy will make you crave ridiculous things.  Cue the Oriental Chicken Salad here.  Come hell or high water, there have been a handful of times I have had to get my mouth around this incredibly lame, yet delicious salad.   We've made the mistake of dining here on all occasions but one.  Aside from the fabulously wonderful host at the host stand (no seriously- this guy takes the cake and the pan it was baked in.  Give him a raise) all the experiences left a lot to be desired.  Whether it is busy or dead you will wait forever for any sort of service once seated at your table.  Both our orders were wrong on 3 different occasions and the server argued with me when I tried to tell him that the Oriental salad didn't come with honey mustard dressing. Really??  You're going to argue with the pregnant lady who is craving a menu item you've had since you opened your doors in the 80s?  Honey mustard dressing on an Oriental salad?  Just a very unfriendly, yuck experience all around. The extra star is for curbside pick up to go.  On the last occasion where my craving for this salad surpassed any amount of reasoning, we opted to go for this option.  I wish I could rate it separately.  Service was great, food correct and they were extremely friendly.  My advice- if you're seriously craving the 'Bee, don't eat inside this location.  Get it to go and indulge in the privacy of your own home- for numerous reasons.
Total renovation.  Looks good. The food lots better than the old restaurant. Will go back.

I am usually a fan of applebee's, but this location has some of the worst service i have ever seen. Every time I gave it another try they disappointed me again by making my group wait 30 minutes for drinks and getting most of the order wrong. We gave this location 3 tries before we gave up for good, and we won't be going back.

I'm not really an Applebee's fan to begin with, but I normally find things on the menu that I like. So, other locations would probably get a 3-4 star from me. However, I wish I could give this one zero stars. The service and food were always very, very bad. (I gave them a few shots and now I'm done) I really wish they would go out of business and give a decent restaurant a shot at this prime location.

I want to start off by saying that this Applebee's location is still open by the grace of some kind of supernatural force because I go to this location once a year for 7 years and nothing has changed.  First, I don't like Applebee's food at all so whenever I did go it is because I am with a group of people and majority rules so I always end up going along.  Second, the wait time is always long at this location and majority of the time it is for no reason. As I speak there are plenty of empty tables that they could feel instead of having us on a false wait and lie to us that it is only a 10 to 15 minute wait time. I don't believe there is even a host because it takes forever for someone to appear at the podium before they notice you are there and obviously the servers dont insist on doing the job themselves or notify someone of guest up front. Third, the food is bland and the alcoholic drinks are watered down. Instead of a server recommending what to get on the menu they just appear and disappear until you make your own decision or leave which they do not care if you do. As I have stated before the food is bland and it was lukewarm as usual. I tell my friends this all the time but they never listen!  Lastly, the dessert my friends had was a cookie skillet and a scoop of ice cream on it. The ice cream was runny and cookie was too firm and lukewarm yet again.  I don't know what people love about Applebee's or this location. I started to ask the workers do they need new hires because they are in desperate need of kitchen and front of the house help.

Never again. So they brought my desert out with a finger nail on the plate. Nasty very nasty.  We notified the manager, and she avoided us...kept us waiting. Finally I went over to her to address the issue and she had a bad attitude...really bad. Then I asked her for corporate number and she acted as though she didn't have it.

I usually enjoy Applebee's but this was has to be the worst one I have ever been to. The place was nasty. I was seated at a dirty table 4 servers walked by me several time but would not stop. After 15 min of waiting I got up and left. The bad thing was that they really wasn't that busy. I will never go back to this store!

Ate here a few nights ago and it was a nightmare. Our server was very nice but the good was disgusting. The bartender and other servers were standing around talking very loud about complete nonsense. The restaurant was VERY dirty!!! Our table was sticky!! I've worked for Applebee's and was shocked. One star is generous. Also had to wait for check for close to 15 minutes after asking for it.

Horrible, horrible, horrible. It has been years since I visited this location, now I know why. I was there a few nights ago, to have a drink and an appetizer. I ordered a strawberry long island iced tea and chicken quesadilla. The service was crappy. I sat at the bar, which was filthy and not tended too, napkins and plates of leftovers were still sitting on the bar. The bartender cleaned the bar once we approached. Anyone that has ordered a long island iced tea, knows that you can taste some sort of liquor, this drink tasted like kool-aid, and you could see right through it, like water. I told the bartender, but she said they did not take drinks back. Okay, I let that go. I get my food order, and it was down right nasty, not appealing to the eye at all. I took one bite, and left the remainder on my plate. The bartender asked me what was wrong, and I told her I did not like it at all. About 30 minutes later the manager came over, and was just standing there in front of us, not saying a word. I asked him what he needed, he said did you ask for a manager, and I told him I did not, but since you are here, I can tell you about this food. He told me that because we were there during "happy hour" times, he could not remove the quesadilla's from my ticket. He did not offer to remake or replace them. I had not asked for him in the first place, but since he came over I asked. Anyway, I only spent $14 there and they will never get another dime from me.
We went in and it was crowded they seated our group and started on our orders the service was a little slow seems like they may have been understaffed plus this was a very busy night.

I went to this restaurant an hour and thirty minutes before they stopped serving food. Once my food came out it was warm. The server I had that night was nice but very forgetful. He said that he had been up all night so I won't hold that against him. He did apologize each time we had to remind him that we were waiting for him to bring our entree and appetizer or our beverages. It was not busy when we arrived at this location. So I do not understand why you have to wait so long for your food. This experience was not as worse as what I encountered at the location in Bartlett but I would suggest that the staff focus more on customer service and speed while ensuring that the food is cooked thoroughly.

The food was not good this evening.  Either too well done or not done enough.  Waitor was not properly trained.  We did not get our drinks refilled.  The silverware was dirty and dessert looked half eaten already.

This is by far the worst Applebee's I have ever visited - and I have been to several locations of this huge chain.  This particular one is run down and has terrible service.  Our waiter seemed to be poorly trained.  He didn't know the menu.  And he kept letting dirty dishes pile up.   My friend's meal was burnt and had to be sent back.    They had only 2 kinds of salad dressings and were told that was because they were "cutting back".      Then we ordered dessert and one of the desserts (the dessert of the friend whose main entree had been burnt) appeared half eaten.    Her "meal" was free, but after this comedy of errors, the ENTIRE meal for everyone should have been at no cost to us.

So after the grizzlies take a horrible loss to golden state last night, my friend and i leave The Forum and go to Applebee's. We're told that Vanessa would be our server. Well, after 20 mins of NO ONE coming to our table or even walking by to serve other customers around us...we left and went to ihop. This is my 2nd bad experience here so i won't be going back or suggesting that my friends go. We all went as a group one night a couple years ago and were seated and then rushed into ordering because the kitchen was closing. So WHY seat us if the kitchen is closing? We're not here 4 drinks only!! AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS

This is the worst Applebee's I have ever been to in my life and that is saying a lot. I love Applebee's and have been to so many of them , everytone in Memphis area and many across the US.  I should have walked out the minute I walked in .  The place smelled like sour mildew.  Obviously, someone had mopped the place with a dirty mop.  Another customer walked out over this.  It was dead at prime lunch time should have told me something.  I would have walked but when I went to the restroom, my husband and son had already ordered our drinks so I felt stuck.  The menus were dirty.  The food was horrible. My husband got shrimp scampi and it was a few pieces of shrimp in tomato sauce...That is not shrimp scampi!  Dont even ask me how they screwed up something as simple as french onion soup.   Monica, our waitress was quite pleasant or I would have totally went off right then and there.  Started to ask for the manager , but if they could not smell how disgusting their restaurant was, then how could they help?  This must seem normal.  I never ever want to go into this establishment again.

My Applebees experience was such a letdown. I try to go back to a restraurant I had a bad experience in to give them a second chance hoping things have changed. Bad move on my part! I first asked if I could get soup instead of fries with an upcharge on one of their new burgers and was told yes. I asked for my soup to come out first. Guess what? It came out the same time. When I reminded her of my request she said "they sent them together". Duh! Fries came with it which were cold and I said "I didn't order fries because I got the soup instead". She then said "They're seperate, you can't get the soup instead of the fries".If I had hair I'd pull it out!" Manager took off the soup charge. By the way, the $10.49 burger was not worth it and the french onion soup was'nt that good either. I should have gone to Five Guys next door. Bye Applebees, we're done! Addendumb: The waitress brought my credit card receipt for me to sign and asked me if I needed a pen to sign it. "No thanks, I'll use my tears!"

Haven't been here in a long time but thought I'd give it a go. It took about 5 minutes to get seated and another 10 minutes before they took our drink orders. Service was extremely slow. Now as for their food, I had the 4 cheese macaroni with honey seared chicken tenders. It was AWESOME!! The spinach dip was mediocre. The chips were over cooked for my taste. All in all, not bad.

If you've ever wanted to feel like you were the star of a homemade rap video shot with the camcorder your dad used to film christmas in the 80 I suggest eating here.  Also might be a good idea to not carry any cash in the restaurant or parking lot.
Service is slow.  I was seated quickly after walking in the door.  But waited fifteen minutes before my order was taken
Sloooowwwww service at the bar. I have came here twice and it may take 15 mins to get my drink. Seems like the people that work here just don't give a shit.
Waitress (Carolyn) is poorly trained. We asked for water with no ice she served warm water... I never happened in other restaurants. She is totally confused with our order and our drinks

Thursday night! Excellent bartender. She kept the drinks coming. Changed the TV to find my game.  Really wonderful evening.  The have bud light on a really good deal, and margaritas on a deal with shots.  Good evening!
Dirty, awful food, wait staff is incompetent, and the place stinks.  Parking lot is not safe either.

This Applebee's @ 2114 union ave. has really gone downhill. I entered  the restaurant at  2:00 pm on 11-14-16  because I haven't had Applebee's in about 5 years. (I SEE WHY IT'S BEEN 5 YRS) The table to my left as many others never had the dirty dishes removed . In fact there was no bussing of tables throughout my whole meal. ( busboy????) The restaurant was not crowded at all yet the music was very loud. should have been turned down to a reasonable level for an empty restaurant. there was some type of tablet on my table to order food with but it had no battery and was covered  with sticky with food and fingerprints  * see photos *  Back to the table to my left the seats were torn and taped, the shrimp I ordered taste like they were cooked in old grease. The front door of the restaurant was broken and propped open * see photos *  I DID NOT BRING ANY OF THESE COMPLAINTS TO THE ATTENTION OF THE MANAGER BECAUSE IF THE RESTAURANT IS THIS DEPLORABLE  AT 2pm THERE'S NO HOPE FOR THIS LOCATION!
Came here with my husband.  Our server was good but there was a hole in the wall at our booth,  area wasn't very clean,  and it took a while for us to get the check.

If you are in search of great service, you definitely need to STAY AWAY from here. On not one, but several occasions I've encountered total unsatisfactory service 1.) My garlic bread was burnt and the rest of my table was golden brown. When I questioned the manager, he stated mine was right and theirs was wrong (true story) 2.) My family was advised by the hostess to dine somewhere else because they were short staffed.  3.) My steak quesadilla was primarily flatbread. On one triangle I had literally ONE piece of steak with sprinkles of cheese. When I spoke to the manager, his response was "that's the way it come, but I can replace it for you."  However, two others ordered it at my table and their order was full of meat (plus theirs was half off for happy hour) I am convinced this particular Applebee's need a complete make over from management to staff.

If you can take the drive elsewhere, do so. It was a short trip from where I was visiting. I ordered carside to go and when I parked an employee was coming outside the door. I thought the employee was coming to my car to deliver my food, but another car pulled in the lot from the wrong direction and she jumped in to talk to them.  A few minutes later, the same employee comes to my car to tell me that they don't have any salad vinaigrette dressing. I'm in awe that m she's even on the clock. Another employee returns with my order. I checked my order, the sides are missing so I walk in and run into the manager. As I'm explaining the situation, the same chatty employee runs around the corner with the bag of sides and interrupts. He seems used to the bs that they pull and I just want my order.  I return to my car and I have to back out of the driveway because the employees friend is still parked outside and I'm blocked.
Can you imagine running out of baked potatoes at 5:50? Dinner hour hasn't even started.

This used to be one of my favorite spots since it is within walking distance from my house. Unfortunately the service has gone way down and I refuse to give my money to an establishment that does not care about their customers. I was greeted by the hostess not by a hello or how are you this evening but rather her notifying me that there will be a gratuity added to my check. I guess I look like I'm not going to tip or Applebee's is punishing all of their customers because of the lack of tips left prior to me coming in to dine. As a former waitress and manager, the customer service was terrible. Gratuity is not required, however service charges are. Once I was seated by the hostess, the waitress came to my table and reminded me of the gratuity that was mandatory. I mean, can I order food? I would have tipped over the gratuity amount of 18% anyway but demanding the gratuity as if you have a crystal ball saying I'm a non tipper made me lose my appetite. So I'm assuming the waitress could sense an irritable customer and went and got her manager that I did request. The manager says so I hear you have a problem with the gratuity? Needless to say, I decided to take my money elsewhere. I will not be eating there ever again and will make sure my network and affiliates do not either.  Piss poor customer service at its finest! This was also on a Thursday night and traffic was steady. Pathetic that the manager came to my table, pathetic that the manager didn't try to get me to stay and even more pathetic that they worried about a gratuity and haven't even taken an order!
Great food, quality service. Especially for the night time, where typically you may get bad service. Loved everything!
